data.title: archives.nypl.org
data.text:
Call number

RBK 23985

Physical description

57.12 linear feet (136 boxes)

Preferred Citation

Pulp Novels, RBK 23985, Rare Book Division, The New York Public Library.

Repository

Rare Book Division

Access to materials

Request an in-person research appointment.

Pulp fiction was published from the late nineteenth to mid-twentieth century. The pulp fiction era provided a breeding ground for creative talent which would influence all forms of entertainment for decades to come. Modern detective and science fiction genres were created by the freedom that the pulp fiction provided.

Scope and arrangement

This collection of pulp novels published between 1915-2004 consists mostly of science fiction and mystery titles. Included within collection are numerous works by Poul Anderson, Isaac Asimov, James Blish, John Brunner, Edgar Rice Burroughs, A. Bertram Chandler, John Creasey, Erle Stanley Gardner, Charles Eric Maine, Stephen Marlowe, Anne McCaffrey, and Andre Norton.

Arrangement

Alphabetical, except for Ace Double Novels which are arranged by book number.
